info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 16 at 2:15PM CDT until March 16 at 3:15PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN COMANCHE...NORTHWESTERN STEPHENS AND NORTHEASTERN COTTON COUNTIES... At 215 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 10 miles north of Corum, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Broadcast media reported golf ball size hail north of Walters. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Duncan, Marlow, Bray, Central High, Empire City and Hulen. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A tornado watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. This storm is producing large hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
